In the morning, passersby find her lifeless body, but she has a smile on her face.
SUBHASH

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {R} If your hand is empty, draw a card.

loreEntryElements.text: Faster, ever faster! Our fire rages highest when the race is afoot!

392 AC - I climb the steep slope with short strides. I suppose "climb" is an interesting word choice. I know I'm climbing along the floating island, but the concept of up and down doesn't really apply here. From where I am, it's like I'm running on flat ground. I look up. Above me, another island floats upside-down in the air. From my inverted position, I see herds of yaks, or animals that look like yaks, grazing peacefully before they scatter at my approach. With a bit of luck… Using Alteration, I create a rocky promontory at my feet. It shoots out from the ground toward the other island. I let myself be carried along with it, adjusting my stance. But as I approach the inverted island, I feel gravity switch directions and suddenly pull me upwards, which is actually now downwards.

I jump and turn in the air, landing on the other side and rolling in the high grass. OK, if I continue along this atoll, it should get me to my destination. But before I continue with my run, I check in on Booda's spirit. He's on a similar island. I feel the wind blowing past his ears as he crosses the rugged plains of the Tilted Steppes. Yaks shamble away as he approaches, and he yowls at them to make them get out of his way. He isn't far off. Not far at all. And he's vibrating with the Mana he's stolen from the Tumult. I smile. In a few hours at most, we'll meet each other. I'll use all the Mana he's collected to stabilize the area and paint it in Bravos colors. Unless another Exalt manages to do it before us. In their dreams! I set off again at a sprint.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: At Noon — If you are the first player, create a [Booda 2/2/2] Companion token in your Companion Expedition.

loreEntryElements.text: Only the worthy shall achieve true transcendence under my guidance.

392 AC - I watch the seething water as the surf drenches me with its spray. The water swishes against my skin as Kaizaimon meanders back and forth, patiently waiting for the right time to come out of hiding. In the spectral darkness, the roaring waves crash against the cliff as a lightning bolt streaks across the raging sky. Around me, the other Bravos soldiers lie on their stomachs, hidden and on the look-out. I see them cursing the cold and water as it penetrates deep into their clothes, but none of them complain. I smile. A few drops of water won't make them waver or shiver. Suddenly, Kai pours out of my skin in a red cloud like a bloody mist. My oni gradually solidifies and regains his original appearance. He starts to float above the bluff where we have taken refuge, waiting to tighten the noose of our ambush.

He looks at the sky, and I do the same, just as a griffon breaks through the clouds. The griffon flies toward the beach with Sigismar on his back. That means it's not far behind. I crack my neck and knuckles. Around me, the other warriors slowly spread out. Some roll their shoulders, while others unsheathe their swords. I turn toward them and give them a smile. They return it. But not with smiles of kindness – more like predatory grins. Good thing that's exactly what I need. Today, I need them to be demons. I scream at them, pumping my fist in the air as the hurricane rages. They roar in return, and some beat their weapons against their shields. The enemy will be formidable, and the challenge immense. But that's what the Bravos have always feasted on. Come on, then, Kraken! We are ready!

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: When a Character you control gains 1 or more boosts — You may exhaust me ({T}) to give target Character 1 boost.

loreEntryElements.text: Fight frost with fire.

I sprint to cover the last few feet and propel myself into the air using a rock for support. I have a smile on my face and I know it, because Boo isn't far away. I can sense him. He's very close. After several days apart, it'll be cool to roll around in the snow together. A little slide, and a little somersault for the sake of it... I suddenly realize that I haven't thought at all about what I'm going to do with the Mana that Boo is bringing me. How about another water park like the one the Lyra created? Nah, one is enough. A ski resort so I can keep practicing what Skadi taught me? Haha, I know I'll be hated if I do that. Hey, you're not a kid anymore, Kojo. Nope, I need to find something more useful, something to help the other Bravos who are following me. I suddenly see a trail of fire streak across the mountain pass, sending up a plume of steam behind it.

Booda! As he draws nearer, he takes on the look of a snow leopard, which I told him to adopt. His fiery mane is burning like crazy, a sign that he's fully gorged himself on Mana. I can build something monumental with that! But before I can put the final touches on what I want to do, Boo jumps into my arms and we collide head-on. He starts to play, leaping around and nibbling on my boots. And as we roll around in the melting snow, I quickly find myself soaked to the skin. I ruffle his fur, and he rolls over onto his back, his flames hissing in the puddle of water forming beneath him. And as I get up, wondering where the Mana he was carrying went, I envisage a giant statue of me giving a thumbs up, like the statue of Rune near where I used to play with my buddies when we were young. Hmm. I think the other Bravos would prefer another water park over a memorial to my ridiculously large ego...
KOJO

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: (If I leave the Expedition zone, remove me from the game.)

loreEntryElements.text: Hot bunny in your area wants to meet!

What's the moral of that story, again? Slow and steady wins the race? First of all, I never understood why the hare thought taking a nap during the race was a good idea. If I'd done that while competing, Carmela would have given me a brutal thrashing I'd never forget. Yeah, OK, I've had my fair share of thrashings, I admit. But never because I had a nap in the middle of a run. All that to say that I'd really like it if the flaming rabbit I'm following would decide to take a nap. But nope, it just keeps jumping and jumping, and I can't catch it. But that's kind of the point: to give me a reason to speed up a bit. What did Basira call it, again? Oh yeah, a carrot. But she'd politely declined when I asked her if she could train me, saying that I should just dangle a carrot in front of my face and keep charging forward.

Thinking back on it now, it was probably just a way to make fun of me. But I'm headstrong and used to being teased, so it went right over my head, like way over. So, I'm chasing a fire rabbit and happy to do so. It helps ensure I don't lose my touch. I mutter to myself. Gul is always saying that all my talent is in my legs; there's nothing in my head or arms. And the worst thing is that she's probably right. Here, I'll need more than my pins, I'm well aware of that. I need to exercise my biceps and definitely my gray matter. And that starts with finding a way to intercept this damned long-earned rodent. As I jump from thought to thought, I think back to the old tale of the monkey, the otter, the rabbit and the old man. Wait... or was it a monkey, fox and bear? Anyway. What I'd learned from the moral of that story was that you should give it all you've got, and that's what I'd tried my best to do all my life.

Source
An old Buddhist tale tells of a rabbit and its friends – a monkey, an otter and a jackal – who wanted to do some charitable work. Deciding to help a hungry beggar, the monkey offered mangoes and water, the otter fresh fish from the river, and the jackal a grilled lizard skewer and some milk curd. The rabbit, having nothing to offer except some blades of grass, willingly jumped into the fire to offer the traveler its own flesh. But, to its surprise, the flames didn't burn it because the old man was in fact Sakra, who had come down to test their altruism. As a reward, the Lord of the Devas drew the rabbit's likeness on the moon so that everyone on earth could remember its virtue.

An old Buddhist tale tells of a rabbit and its friends – a monkey, an otter and a jackal – who wanted to do some charitable work. Deciding to help a hungry beggar, the monkey offered mangoes and water, the otter fresh fish from the river, and the jackal a grilled lizard skewer and some milk curd. The rabbit, having nothing to offer except some blades of grass, willingly jumped into the fire to offer the traveler its own flesh. But, to its surprise, the flames didn't burn it because the old man was in fact Sakra, who had come down to test their altruism. As a reward, the Lord of the Devas drew the rabbit's likeness on the moon so that everyone on earth could remember its virtue.
KOJO

cardRulings.question: If I play a Fire Rabbit from hand in an Expedition with Arcolano Milk, can I activate the {h} effect of the Rabbit?
cardRulings.answer: Both reactions are triggered at the same time, but then you resolve your reactions (including  "When X happens — "; {h}, {r}, and {j} abilities) in the order of your choice. So you can choose to first resolve the Fire Rabbit effect (giving 1 boost to another Character) then resolve the effects of Arcolano Milk.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {H} You may have me gain [[Fleeting]]. If you do, another target Character gains 1 boost.
elements.ECHO_EFFECT: #{D} : The next Character you play this turn gains 1 boost.# (Discard me from Reserve to do this.)

loreEntryElements.text: Life is a slope. It's slow going up, and quick going down.

Concentrating on the descent, I try to transfer my body weight over my skis at the right time to avoid the fir trees that are appearing at full speed in front of me. While every part of me is trying to prevent a collision, Skadi has the audacity to perform acrobatics with the nonchalance of a true expert. She moves effortlessly. She just glides, easily and naturally. It's annoying... and a little demoralizing. I'm an expert in the art of movement, but this is too much for me. I pant for breath, hands gripping the poles tightly. She turns towards me without paying attention to the obstacles below, and treats me to a display of the moves she wants me to do. I'm about to respond when I realize a tree is far too close to me. I have to plant a pole instantly to quickly change course and avoid catastrophe.

She laughs and gives me a thumbs up. And then she's off again, in a single bound. Fascinated, I watch her graceful aerial ballet. Idiot! I didn't see the bump that she just jumped! I go flying, limbs everywhere, legs above my head... I fall inelegantly into a snowdrift, which saves me from a more painful crash, but my ego has been severely damaged. The Eidolon stops gently next to me, while I struggle to get up, fighting with my skis. She shakes her head, flapping her long braid of blonde hair. With a smirk on her face, she patiently waits until I'm standing up before teasing me about the trick I just pulled off. Brushing the snow off my clothes, I try to find a witty comeback. No. Best to keep a low profile. I feel like even the snowmen around the camp are laughing at me.

Source
Skadi is a deity from Norse mythology: the goddess of winter, mountains and hunting. She is the daughter of the giant Thjazi and wife of the god Njörd. The name Scandinavia, which could mean "Skadi's island", may be named after her. After the death of her father, killed by the gods of Asgard, she takes up arms against them to seek vengeance. But the Aesir, aware of her just cause, pardon her rebellion and offer her suitable compensation, including placing Thjazi's eyes in the sky in the form of stars shining in the heavens.

Skadi is a deity from Norse mythology: the goddess of winter, mountains and hunting. She is the daughter of the giant Thjazi and wife of the god Njörd. The name Scandinavia, which could mean "Skadi's island", may be named after her. After the death of her father, killed by the gods of Asgard, she takes up arms against them to seek vengeance. But the Aesir, aware of her just cause, pardon her rebellion and offer her suitable compensation, even placing Thjazi's eyes in the sky in the form of stars shining in the heavens.
KOJO

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {R} You may exhaust ({T}) target card in Reserve. (Exhausted cards can't be played and have no Support abilities.)

Concentrating on the descent, I try to transfer my body weight over my skis at the right time to avoid the fir trees that are appearing at full speed in front of me. While every part of me is trying to prevent a collision, Skadi has the audacity to perform acrobatics with the nonchalance of a true expert. She moves effortlessly. She just glides, easily and naturally. It's annoying... and a little demoralizing. I'm an expert in the art of movement, but this is too much for me. I pant for breath, hands gripping the poles tightly. She turns towards me without paying attention to the obstacles below, and treats me to a display of the moves she wants me to do. I'm about to respond when I realize a tree is far too close to me. I have to plant a pole instantly to quickly change course and avoid catastrophe.

She laughs and gives me a thumbs up. And then she's off again, in a single bound. Fascinated, I watch her graceful aerial ballet. Idiot! I didn't see the bump that she just jumped! I go flying, limbs everywhere, legs above my head... I fall inelegantly into a snowdrift, which saves me from a more painful crash, but my ego has been severely damaged. The Eidolon stops gently next to me, while I struggle to get up, fighting with my skis. She shakes her head, flapping her long braid of blonde hair. With a smirk on her face, she patiently waits until I'm standing up before teasing me about the trick I just pulled off. Brushing the snow off my clothes, I try to find a witty comeback. No. Best to keep a low profile. I feel like even the snowmen around the camp are laughing at me.

Source
Skadi is a deity from Norse mythology: the goddess of winter, mountains and hunting. She is the daughter of the giant Thjazi and wife of the god Njörd. The name Scandinavia, which could mean "Skadi's island", may be named after her. After the death of her father, killed by the gods of Asgard, she takes up arms against them to seek vengeance. But the Aesir, aware of her just cause, pardon her rebellion and offer her suitable compensation, including placing Thjazi's eyes in the sky in the form of stars shining in the heavens.

KOJO

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {R} #If I'm in {M}, [Sabotage]. Otherwise,# you may exhaust ({T}) target card in Reserve. (Exhausted cards can't be played and have no Support abilities.)

loreEntryElements.text: Those who have lived a lot have plenty to share.

I remember Shahram and his booming voice. The old veteran was sitting next to me. He put a calloused hand on my shoulder as I shivered from the cold and from fear in the cockpit of the airship. He had taken it on himself to make wisecracks, tell me bawdy jokes and congratulate me on having held on until help arrived... to have survived. It wasn't what I wanted to hear back then. It made my guts feel all twisted inside. He had noticed, of course. Abandoning his flippant air for a moment, he had put his arms around me and said – clumsily, of course – that it wasn't my fault, that I didn't have to feel guilty. He meant well. And strangely enough, here I am thinking about him again decades later. Watching the troops around the fire, huddling close together to try and keep warm, I sense that they could do with a bit of his swagger right now.

Instinctively, his Eidolon is there among us, laughing at our sullen attitudes. He looks defiantly at the group, sticks out his chest, and dishes out some heavy slaps on the backs of the listless adventurers. He boasts that, in his time, no Bravos would ever have given in to despair. Met with grumbles, he then proceeds to recount his extraordinary exploits, which he has had fully tattooed on his bulging biceps. With much bombast and in great detail, he talks about the storming of Vedren, the defeat of Mezzaren... While some Bravos just shake their heads, others listen fascinated to the old man's exaggerated stories of bravado. Even as their protests fly, I know that the old Seiringar has achieved his goal. By firing everyone up, he's warmed their bodies, and that helps them to endure the cold. The last time I saw him, almost a decade ago, I felt that his spirits had been crushed after not being chosen to join the Corps. But perhaps having him here among us now, through me, was the tribute I always wanted to pay him...
BASIRA

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: When I leave the Expedition zone, if I was [[Fleeting]] — Draw a card.

loreEntryElements.text: "It will be a collective effort; it must be a joint endeavor!"

I look all around me, trying to comprehend the scale of the disaster. Everything has been buried under snow, almost as far as the eye can see. Where the Alterers had cleared a path to climb the steep slope is now nothing more than a white carpet. But there isn't a moment to lose, so I start searching. I sink my probe into the frozen blanket and feel it go deep. Then I move forward a few steps and do it once more. Again, nothing. It's been over five minutes since we arrived, ten since the avalanche hit. And the minutes keep ticking away. I pierce the thick layer of packed snow again and suddenly feel some resistance. I take off my glove and use my fingers to whistle. Almost immediately, Chaghagan arrives at my side, shovel in hand and leaving deep furrows in the snow from his heavy steps. I show him where to dig, and then I continue with my assigned task.

The probe goes down again and again. I climb the slope and occasionally glance behind me. Chagha is digging. A few feet above our heads, the Axiom engineer's Alter Ego circles and beeps. Time seems to be standing still, yet also moving faster than grains of sand from a broken hourglass. Luckily for us, the Alter Ego had managed to drop beacons to indicate the approximate whereabouts of victims. Otherwise, their fate would have been sealed much earlier. Chagha finally digs something up. It looks like a small animal with white fur. Probably one of the region's local species. I clench my teeth to keep from cursing. I'd hoped we had found one of our own. Chaghagan takes the animal he's just freed, revealing another just underneath, which shakes itself off. I can't help smiling as I notice the Trailblazer's mop of pink hair, and I wonder what bet he lost to have had to dye it that color...
BASIRA

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {J} If you control a [[Fleeting]] Character, I gain 1 boost.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {J} I gain 1 boost #per [[Fleeting]] Character you control.#

loreEntryElements.text: "Their ranks will be composed of seasoned argonauts, ready to face the perils of the unknown!"

I don't want to slow down, but I notice with relief that more and more victims of the avalanche are being pulled from the snow by our rescue team. Not far from me, Catriona is summoning the idea of heat itself to warm up an Ordis recruit. I feel a warm air current caress my face and start to dream of a hot place to relax my muscles, like I saw those damned Lyra doing just yesterday. Ha! I suddenly feel exhausted from the extra effort we've had to put in, barely a few hours after returning from the expedition. We didn't even have time to rest or finish our bowl of soup... But I don't regret answering the call, considering all the people we're saving. That obviously justifies the extra soreness we'll feel after this ordeal.

As I watch the Bravos rescuer, I wonder where her younger sister Aoife is. Maybe she was deployed on the western flank to help or guide the little Brassbug army that was dropped from the Ouroboros? Or did she stay onboard? Whereas Aoife is an experienced adventurer who can sometimes take a few too many risks, Cat radiates kindness and generosity. And with Aoife's tendency to rush in, having someone to take care of minor wounds once the job is done is a great help. They are certainly polar opposites. But they also clearly complement each other. That was evident at the start of their training, and it's still the case. I smile in spite of everything. With Chagha, solid and taciturn as a rock, and Cat, dedicated and always calm, it seems my little protégé is in good hands.
BASIRA

elements.ECHO_EFFECT: {D} : Target Character loses [[Fleeting]]. (Discard me from Reserve to do this.)

elements.ECHO_EFFECT: {D} : Target Character loses [[Fleeting]]. (Discard me from Reserve to do this.)

loreEntryElements.text: "What doesn't kill you makes you stronger."

The Eidolon tries to get the measure of me, evaluating me in a slow back and forth from left to right, showing me only its profile. As for me, I'm not even on guard. My blade rests along my body. This is all part of the ritual, of the dueling game we play. As Tomoe told me: The fight always starts in the opponents' heads. Having claimed victory over each champion of the fencing schools, Gericht had established himself as the master of his discipline. He slowly unsheathes two of his sabers, then remains motionless. I try to read his mind, watching each of his tensing muscles to work out how he'll attack. Then, before I can understand how, he's already upon me, drawing circles with his weapons. It's his signature attack! Ember! I jump back at the very last moment, but he's already there to intercept me where I land. I survive only because of a reflex dodge, which forces me to jump to one side.

I can't let myself be pushed around. Taking advantage of the natural imbalance of my body, I turn around and immediately counterattack, preparing to slash him with the edge of my blade. But my sword just finds his. There's another clash of metal, then a feint. I'm reading his moves, and he reads mine. We settle into a bout of sparring as we try to land blows on each other. It seems to last forever. I face some unexpected combos, which I just barely manage to counter. Gericht is a virtuoso, a master of the steel dance. But how do I seize the upper hand? For a moment, I consider using my secret strike, but I resist the temptation and dismiss the idea. I don't need it yet. I want to know how long I can last. I face attack after attack. I suddenly spot a gap in his guard. But is that really what it is?
ATSADI

cardRulings.question: What happens if Gericht, Revered Duelist is already Fleeting and should gain Fleeting due to another effect?
cardRulings.answer: It gains Fleeting again (which in general doesn't change anything, but gives him a boost). The power of the Common version of Gericht is an exception to the general rule that a Character cannot gain Fleeting if it's already Fleeting.

loreEntryElements.text: They're deadly on land, and even deadlier in the water.

I stretch and massage my lower back to relieve the soreness. Making any progress on the ice pack is constant torture. My whole body is tense from trying to maintain my balance as the Akhlut breaks through the ice with violent blows with its snout. Easy now, don't you know you have an old woman on your back? I feel a certain relief when our guide points to the shoreline. I catch myself sighing. It will feel good to drop my bag on the shore after this sea voyage. With a final ominous crack, the Akhlut climbs onto the shore. I need no encouragement to climb down from the saddle. I crack my back and take a few steps to loosen my aching thighs. As I pet the neck of my mount, I watch its head becoming slimmer as it shakes, and I step back, fascinated as I watch it slowly transform.

The smooth skin of the sea mammal gradually develops patches of bushy hair, which slowly turns into dense black and white fur. Its fins extend and become muscular legs with claws. It stands up and starts to walk across the snow. And all around, the rest of the pack also transforms from aquatic creatures to land mammals. I mutter to myself. I shouldn't be getting absorbed in this spectacle – I've got work to do. It seems Filiki passed his bad habits on to me. I go to find our guide, who is petting the muzzle of his own Akhlut. The animal raises its head as I approach. I reach into my bag for the sextant that will help us calculate the route taken by the Ouroboros. OK, just a few more days and then we can all collapse in the mess hall for a well-deserved rest.

Source
The Akhlut is a creature from Inuit mythology. This composite animal is an orca that takes the form of a wolf when on land. It is sometimes depicted as a wolf-orca hybrid that can shapeshift easily between the two based on the situation. Legends about the creature arose when hunters noticed wolf tracks disappearing into the sea or at the edges of watering holes, as if they had dived in. Among the Inuit, Akhluts are said to be very fierce and will hunt down humans who venture too far off the beaten path.

Among the Inuit, Akhluts are said to be very fierce and will hunt down humans who venture too far off the beaten path.
BASIRA

loreEntryElements.text: The lone wolf guards its territory jealously.

It starts with a sort of fog, a mist that shimmers and takes shape as the air begins to vibrate. The quaking becomes a rumble as the figure grows larger and larger and takes on the shape of a wolf. Then a huge fang-filled maw opens as the Amarok materializes in all its glory and voracious hunger. It could swallow me whole, in a single mouthful. It looks a bit like the Big Bad Wolf. I glance at the Altrunner's side. I had told Kojo not to call on her, but he just did as he pleased. Now she must not flinch. If we want the Amarok to focus on the Belisenki, she must not even blink. Just then I hear the brazen one give the order to this Cathal to run away. I clench my teeth. Might as well have painted a target on her back!

Losing interest in our enemies, the Amarok starts charging through the pines, flattening them like stalks of wheat. As it runs, the wolf assumes gigantic proportions while its fur becomes covered with a thin layer of frost. Its stare is opalescent, its canine teeth are the size of a grown human. Kojo's Eidolon speeds up as much as she can in the snow, using the trees for support and Alteration to push her forward. But all her efforts are in vain. The beast with its oversized legs catches up to her in a single stride, lips curled up in a carnivorous grin. There's a snap of teeth chomping down, and I have to force myself not to look away. The tracer had dashed to a tree trunk then leapt into the air, luckily landing on the wolf's fur. I shake my head. Besides failing to eliminate the Belasenka threat, now I also had to prevent Kojo's Eidolon from winding up as a light snack.

Source
The Amarok is a giant creature that features in Inuit mythology. Amarok means "wolf spirit". Although it stalks people foolish enough to hunt alone, it also works to maintain balance in the environment: Its wolf brothers keep caribou herds healthy, which is essential for human survival, by eliminating the weaker animals. Legend says that the first woman asked the god of the sky, Kaila, for a way to stop the caribou herds from getting weaker. The god asked the Amarok to tell its wolf brothers to eat the weak or sick caribous to ensure that the species would be strong and healthy.

Although it stalks people foolish enough to hunt alone, it also works to maintain balance in the environment: Its wolf brothers keep caribou herds healthy, which is essential for human survival, by eliminating the weaker animals. Legend says that the first woman asked the god of the sky, Kaila, for a way to stop the caribou herds from getting weaker. The god asked the Amarok to tell its wolf brothers to eat the weak or sick caribous to ensure that the species would be strong and healthy.
ATSADI

cardRulings.question: What happens if a Gigantic Character is played in the other Expedition (the one Amarok is not in)?
cardRulings.answer: It gets sacrificed.

cardRulings.question: What happens if Amarok is Gigantic, for example thanks to Eat Me Energy Bars?
cardRulings.answer: For a Gigantic Character, "my Expedition" means "the Expeditions I'm in".  Any Character played in either Expedition of a Gigantic Amarok will be sacrificed. Note that when you play Amarok, you check "the Expedition it's played in" as you pay its cost, before it's Gigantic.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: I cost {2} less to play in an Expedition with no Characters.  When another Character joins my Expedition — Sacrifice it.

loreEntryElements.text: He's got more than one arrow in his quiver.

I slow down, watching Kojo disappear over the other side of the crest. I had barely set foot in the pass when the Belisenki burst out of the snowdrifts, forming swirling clouds of snowflakes. They emerge from their snowbanks with a sinister tinkling and humming sound. Some twenty pairs of black eyes stare at me, like a score of dark threats. My blade is immediately in my hand, but I realize it's already too late. It's clear that they have the numerical advantage. I need time to prepare a fitting response. Ember! My heart sinks. No. No, I can't let myself be slowed down any further. Aurora is waiting for me in her crystal prison. No, this can't be the end of the road for me. I stand on guard, trying to find a way out while readying myself for the imminent attack. I draw on the love I feel for her to give me courage. I call on the love that has guided each of my steps.

Like a meteorite, a flaming spirit lands on my right side, while an intense light begins to shine just above me, dazzling and comforting me. The ice creatures freeze for a moment, blinded, as a figure appears before me. It's Eros gracing me with his presence. Did I just instinctively materialize him? Was it Surge that came to my aid? It doesn't matter. I won't let this opportunity go to waste. The Belisenki blink frantically, and their black eyes open again. But luck is starting to turn in my favor. Two, then three flaming beings land and create a barrier between me and the Belisenki. The creatures hesitate, and rightly so. Eros laughs as his wings unfurl. I smile and am now encouraged, reassured and raring to go. I step back and focus on my next attack. I let Eros make the first move, which gives me time to summon the blazing fire.

Source
Eros is the god of love and procreation in the Greek pantheon. Son of Chaos, he is one of the primordial deities along with Gaia, Nyx, Tartare and Erebus. He was born from the cosmic egg, created by the union of Aether and Chaos. In early depictions he represented a non-sexual union, like friendship. The sexual depiction of Eros came about with the castration of Uranus by Cronus, when Cronus threw his father's genitals into the sea. This act gave rise to Aphrodite, Himeros and the new incarnation of Eros. In both his primordial and subsequent depictions, he represents the force of attraction that pushes partners to be together.

This act gave rise to Aphrodite, Himeros and the new incarnation of Eros. In both his primordial and subsequent depictions, he represents the force of attraction that pushes partners to be together.
ATSADI

cardRulings.question: In which order are the effects triggered by playing Eros and by playing the Character thanks to Eros effect resolved?
cardRulings.answer: 1. Eros is played  2. Any effects triggered by playing Eros join Limbo (the pool of effects "to be resolved")  3. The active player starts resolving their effects in Limbo (in the order of their choice)  (3.a Depending on the player's choice and who's the active player, some effects may be resolved before a 2nd Character is played)  3.b Whenever Eros's controller resolves the effect of Eros, they play their 2nd Character.  3.c Any effects triggered by playing the new Character joins Limbo  3.d The active player may now resolve any of their effects in Limbo (in the order of their choice), including ones triggered in 3.c  3.e Once the active player has finished, the next player resolves the effects they still have in Limbo.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {J} You may immediately play a Character for {3} less.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {J} You may immediately play a Character for {3} less. #It gains 2 boosts.#

loreEntryElements.text: He summons the mightiest beings just for the sake of an epic duel.

Four. I watch the figure of Eros disappear as I count down. The god's wings molt in clouds of feathers that drift in the air before vanishing, carried away by the winds. Three. In his wake, the other Eidolons also disappear, like candles being snuffed out one by one. But they have done their job: They bought me the time I needed. As they disintegrate, the Eidolons release the ideas that shaped them. I feel them boil against my skin, and I feed on them. They fill my entire body. Two. As I keep my sword planted in the ground like a lightning rod, Surge slams into my blade again and again, filling the air with static energy. Flame and lightning. One. Engorged with ideas, I feel them being absorbed by my psyche, by my body. I don't need to think; I just need to express who I am to influence the world around me. I just need to listen to my instincts.

Zero. Lightning bolts begin to streak across the ice, shattering it in their path. Wherever the lightning splits and breaks the ice, steaming water gushes forth, bubbling up from underground. The pressure I've been holding back is finally released, and with it, all my violence. Under a heavy, scalding rain, I materialize a new Eidolon. Forged from the ashes of the ones before, it glows with searing heat. It won't bend as it faces the swarms of Belisenki. Come closer, if you dare. The creatures teem in the air like moths at night over a bonfire. Are they even aware of the threat? Will they throw themselves into the flames? Around me, waterspouts rise from the ground in furious spirals before collapsing in hot showers. The Belisenki swirl around me like starlings. I can feel them hesitating. Too bad for them, because I won't hesitate.
ATSADI

cardRulings.question: If I play a Character with a {j} ability using Mana Flare, while I have an effect triggered by playing a spell (such as Afanas), in which order do I resolve them ?
cardRulings.answer: First, you finish resolving the Spell (playing the Character). Then, the active player (you) resolve all their reactions triggered by playing the spell and the Character, in the order of their choice. (This may include effects such as "When you play a Spell —", "When you play a Character —", {h}, {j}, {r} abilities, etc).

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fleeting]].  Immediately play a Character for {5} less. It gains [[Fleeting]]. (If it would be sent to Reserve, discard it instead.)

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fleeting]]. (Send me to Discard instead of Reserve after my effect resolves.)  Immediately play a Character for {5} less.

loreEntryElements.text: Under pressure!

I stare at the huge columns of water and steam spurting out of the ground. It's fascinating but unsettling at the same time, so much so that I can't look away. It's as if the earth has become a massive pressure cooker. I turn around to say something but realize that I wanted to call out to Gault. But he's not here, of course. He's like a thousand miles away. When I arrived yesterday after a long day trudging through the plains, I was told it was Atsadi who had created this place a few days ago while he was up against hordes of Belisenki. I can't believe the power he's unleashed here. They call him the one-armed swordsman or the Cicada of Dusk, and you can tell his reputation is well earned. He's literally made the ground bleed with huge bubbles.

It's weird to see that the site of such an epic battle has become a sort of aquatic amusement park. The Lyra took over the place and converted it into an open-air pool. They cooled it down, of course, so that no one got boiled alive, and then leveled it all to keep the water in. And now, everyone is bathing, splashing around and chatting... If someone had told me yesterday, as we were struggling to traverse the frozen wilderness, that today I'd be taking it easy in some hot springs, I'd never have believed it. So, while I let my mind wander, wondering if Atsadi would take on a squire, I'm suddenly splashed by a Magpeng and a Tanuki squabbling over who's next on the launch pad. The Magpeng wins the argument and jumps just in time as the ground begins to rumble. An immense geyser shoots it up into the sky as it screams with laughter.
KOJO

cardRulings.question: If I play "Geyser" from Reserve and it gains Fleeting, do I still put it in my Mana Orbs?
cardRulings.answer: Yes.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Return target Character or Permanent to its owner's hand, then put me in your Mana zone (as an exhausted Mana Orb).

loreEntryElements.text: Nobody knows where this "milk" actually comes from.

This is the way, the Milky Way!

Harvested by hand within the Hypogea, the mysterious subterranean world that extends under the Sarkans Desert, Arcolano Milk™ is one of the wonders of Asgartha. Freshly drawn from local Caecaster farms, Arcolano Milk cleanses the mind and helps you sleep well. Drinking Arcolano Milk every day fuels your imagination and promotes unbounded creativity.

Overconsumption of Arcolano Milk poses a risk to health. Please drink responsibly.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: When a Character joins my Expedition — It gains 1 boost and [[Fleeting]]. (If it would be sent to Reserve, discard it instead.)

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: When a Character joins my Expedition — It gains #2 boosts# and [[Fleeting]].

loreEntryElements.text: There's no luck, only preparation.

I'm curious, I'll admit. Very curious... maybe even too curious! But hey, we are who we are, right? So when I saw Skadi carelessly drop her equipment bag next to the camp and go for a walk, well, it just felt like too good of an opportunity. Quick glance to the left, then to the right. No one around. And so I start rummaging through her gear. Inside, I find lots of things she must use for hunting and living in the mountains. Rope, carabiner, whetstone... But something else immediately grabs my attention: a pair of boots. They are bright red, have a strange design, and are simply begging to be tried on. And because I'm so polite, I can't say no. What harm could it do? And I need to know if they're my size. Without further hesitation, I slip a boot on. It seems to adapt to my foot, expanding in length and width to envelop my foot like a stocking. Cool, they're so comfortable!

A strange knob on the ankle turns on and flashes red. That's right, Kojo, you should always press flashing red knobs. Maybe it adjusts the temperature? A heated boot: That would be so cool! Well, hot, I guess. I turn the knob to see what it does. A set of spurs shoots out from under the sole. Er, is that what it's supposed to do? Well, it's not heating, but still cool: These mountaineering crampons could be really useful. And because I can't help myself, I go looking for other hidden features. I turn the knob another notch. Whoosh! A blade-shaped flame shoots out from a ridge in the middle of the sole. I move back slightly in surprise. Wow, is that an ice skate? Someone suddenly taps me on the shoulder, and I know I've been busted. That floozie Skadi has her arms folded across her chest and is looking at me rather disapprovingly.
KOJO

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: When my Expedition moves forward — Target Character in my Expedition loses [[Fleeting]].

loreEntryElements.text: Too good to share.

OK, let's read some of this script. I'm chewing while reading the first page. "Kojo's stomach starts to rumble loudly." Yep, confirmed. Thankfully there are treats for the staff. OK, a line of dialog: "During expeditions, I often need a pick-me-up." Yep, I can definitely say that with conviction... Haha. It's funny when I think about it. A few months ago, I was a nobody; and now, they're asking me to star in altavista ads. I can just image what Gault and the others will say when they see my face filling the screen during the show. Blah blah blah. I swallow what's in my mouth and bite into the candy bar again. "To regain my energy, I always keep an Eat Me bar in my pocket!" Yep, classic. I say the phrase a few times in my head. "To regain my energy, nothing beats..." No, it's "I always fill my pockets..."

OK, focus, Kojo. I scrunch up the wrapper and stuff it in my pocket without really thinking. Then I swallow the last mouthful. While reading the rest of the script, I feel around to find a new bar. "With Eat Me, the bar that makes you grow, I'm playing in the big leagues!" Blah blah blah, and then it finishes with the slogan: "Eat Me: The little break for big moments!" OK, easy, especially because it gives me a nice break. I stuff a whole bar in my mouth and carry on eating happily. Wow, these are good, but they don't half make you thirsty! I turn to the assistant to ask for some water, only to see her drop her notepad with a horrified look on her face. What? I stare at her and look around me to see what I did wrong. And then I realize that I've just eaten half a dozen of the candy bars I'm meant to be promoting. Hmm. What is it they were saying about big moments? Big in what way?

Source
In the book "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" by Lewis Carroll, Alice drinks from a bottle labeled "Drink me" to access a garden through a tiny door. She then starts to shrink small enough to fit through the door. However, the key to the door was left on a table, which she can't reach now that she's small. So she then eats a cake labeled "Eat me" and grows to an enormous size.

She then starts to shrink small enough to fit through the door. However, the key to the door was left on a table, which she can't reach now that she's small. So she then eats a cake labeled "Eat me" and grows to an enormous size.
KOJO

cardRulings.question: If a Gigantic Character has an effect referring to "my Expedition", which Expedition is it?
cardRulings.answer: Its effects affecting its Expedition affect both Expeditions it's in.

cardRulings.question: If a Gigantic Character has an effect referring to "the Expedition facing me", which Expedition is it?
cardRulings.answer: If an effect refers to the Expedition facing a gigantic character, it refers to the Expeditions facing each of its controller’s expeditions. For example, if you play Sakarabru in an Expedition containing the Eat Me Energy Bars, both your opponent's Expeditions move backwards.

cardRulings.question: If there's an Eat Me Energy Bars in both of my Expeditions, and I play one Character in each, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: The first Character you play will become Gigantic. Therefore, when you play the second Character, it will not be alone in its Expedition, so the other Eat Me Energy Bar won't have any effect (until the first Character or the first Eat Me Energy Bar is somehow removed).

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: If there is only one Character in my Expedition, it is [Gigantic]. (It is considered present in each of your Expeditions.)
